Conversion from PVCS to StarTeam

Wrapping a StarTeam project around PVCS archives makes it possible to use either application to access the files in the wrapped project.

On the Windows client, after the wrapping process has been completed, you can permanently convert the VSS project to StarTeam. Once you convert the project, changes to the files will be reflected in StarTeam only, and you can delete the PVCS archives.

All the working files in the current StarTeam folder hierarchy on the computer where you perform the conversion process will be converted to StarTeam storage types. Make sure you have a working file in the hierarchy for each PVCS archive to be converted.

Depending on the size of the wrapped project, the conversion process may be time consuming. Before you begin, it is extremely important to make sure that all users are logged off StarTeam and PVCS. At any time, you can interrupt the conversion procedure and restore the files to their original PVCS format.

Note: The Cross-Platform client supports projects based on foreign archives, such as PVCS, but cannot convert them to StarTeam.

To convert an interoperable project to StarTeam storage (Windows client only):

  1. From StarTeam, select Project > Open, select a server from the left pane, and open the interoperable project.

  2. Select Tools > Convert to Native Format from the menu bar. A message asks you to verify the conversion of the files in this project to the StarTeam storage type.

  3. Click OK. The Converting Foreign Archives dialog opens, and the conversion process begins.

    4. If e-mail is enabled in StarTeam, the application will send you (the logged-on user) an e-mail when the process completes. Depending on the number and size of the archives being converted, the process may take some time.

    A GoNative log file provides even more data. It is stored in repositoryFolder\Logs\Files_Logs where repositoryFolder is the location set for the  server configuration's repository. The log file has the name GoNative.locale.log.
